greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of orbits of order exactly k under doubling map which remain in a semicircle, with k dividing n.
comment: If alpha = exp(2*i*Pi*T(n,k)/(2^n - 1)), the orbit of alpha has period n and stays in the semicircle of minimal argument alpha.
formula: T(n, k) = Sum_{j=0..n-1} 2^[n*j/k], for k such that (k, n)=1.
example: with the length of each row given by phi(n) = A000010(n).
results.author: Francois Maurel (maurel(AT)sequoia.ens.fr)
